annotation.TEXT: Silk Shot almost reminds me a bit of Dust Crusher, except the former happens to fire out in an arc. In any case, it's easily one of the strongest weapons in the game. Its charged version adds even more damage output on top of this (along with producing more spread-shots after it hits something).

It's actually possible to dash underneath this third moving platform, but it's such a risky move that it's generally not worth it. The vertical platform on the other side would also need to be in a good pattern for you to get any real use out of the trick (though you'll likely have to end up waiting for it to come back down regardless).

So then, time to start the semi-pacifist part of the playthrough. The next two stages can basically be summed up as "bump into all the things." There's a few enemies I take out here and there for various reasons, but for the most part, this part just involves straight up rushing to the bosses.

Just to note: In my usual runs of this stage, I would normally use Bubble Splash's charged ability to get by this next section. During this run however, I decided to change it to Speed Burner. For whatever reason, Bubble Splash's charged ability caused some serious slowdown during my first attempt at this (even more-so than the slowdown that's already effecting this run). The strange thing is that the slowdown was only on X, since the falling blocks moved at their normal speeds.

Magnet Mine is the one weapon in the game that I honestly don't like. I don't care that much for aiming weapons to begin with (Phantom Fuse being the one exception, since it has god-like damage output and huge range). The slow speed on this thing also doesn't help matters. It's not as slow as something like the F-Laser, but it's still pretty slow compared to most of the other weapons. Aside from Agile, you probably won't see this used much during the rest of the run.
